Please take time to read their flyer and learn more. They have some great ideas about how to keep yourself healthy‚Ä¶ physically, emotionally, and mentally. They also have contact information if you would like to reach out to them to talk with someone.

Sincerely,

Dr. Jennifer Goodman
Superintendent

Update on Police at OAG Dismissal Today - October 3, 2017

Dear Odyssey Academy - Galveston Community,

We wanted to update you on the police officers at dismissal today.

Administrators received a report from students that they saw what appeared to be a student being suspiciously taken from the school. Police were notified as a precaution while teachers and administrators began researching the claim from the students. After investigating, it was determined that the student in question was picked up according to OA policies, and by an approved adult.

OA takes reports regarding the safety of our students seriously, and will continue to take all appropriate precautions to ensure the safety of your students at our schools.

We appreciate your support and commitment in following our arrival and dismissal policies, enabling us to make sure your students arrive and depart the school safely.

Thank you,
Odyssey Academy Administration

An amazing experience! Before we went to the cemetery we stopped by a museum that began with WWI and showed the build up to WWII. At the end of the tour there was a video that was shown that was split screen and it showed the Germans and the Allies preparing for D-Day. The video was so well done and the ability to capture both sides and to see real emotions on both sides was incredibly humbling. There was not a word spoken after the video. It was so silent you could hear a pin drop. My prayer is that many other students at Odyssey will go and see this historical sight. It is one thing to read about it in books but to actually be there and breath the same air and hear the waves crashing and to envision the war going on around is incredibly moving.
